text: Here are super high res versions of the unlands
Swamp is easily my favorite
Naturally.

Hrm...I missed this but apparently WotC is considering changing the Planeswalker damage redirection rule. 

<https://mobile.twitter.com/MishrasFotoshop/status/906194442977247233>
Yea I saw that this morning too.
From Aaron Forsythe: "Good eye! We are looking at removing the "planeswalker redirection rule" at some point in the near future. Will require a chunk of errata. "
That would be super unfortunate I think
I agree.
Hmm... not sure how I feel about that.
And make planeswalkers kinda hard to deal with in formats without much "deal damage to target planeswalker" effects
Based on the mention of errata, the implication is all "damage to a player" will be errat'd to be player or Planeswalker?
Otherwise, what would there be to errata?

Yea, that's what he was saying.
This kind of change might be too invasive?
That's a huge history of cards that would need errata.
Not sure
Yea, pretty much every card that says "to target player" regarding damage. Which is a lot
I'm not sure the purpose of the errata it all you're doing is spelling out the rule on each card?
Seems like a lot of needless busywork so I'm missing something.
I don't know what the big payoff for the change would be. Like, what is their hope for the change and is it worth the effort/backlash?
Is the redirect rule confusing to new users? If that's the impetuous then just spell it out on new cards vs such a huge errata undertaking.
By the time new players play with older cards they can handle the redirect rule.

I get that they would want to make some stuff exclusive to targeting planeswalkers vs players, but that would mean they have to make planeswalkers so powerful they become ubiquitous and then the cards that target planeswalkers and not players are finally worth running
That seems shortsighted.
Or it could be something we don't understand now that they have a grand scheme for that will make sense later. Which has happened before
It must considering the amount of work this would require.
I've never run a massive game like magic. They're much better at it than I imagine I would be
That's why I agree that I'm missing something.
But if they want to make damage to Planeswalker only cards that seems SUPER situational.
Oh well. We'll see.
Yea, that's my big concern too.
They'd have to make it so every standard deck has no choice but to play them, and then we're back to the power creep conversation
Yeah. It must be something else then.
That or we're completely overreacting about nothing
On the confusion note, it's definitely not intuitive. I could see them wanting to fix that, but I don't think it's worth it
Doubtful. Most companies don't like to engage in expensive, seemingly needless, and potentially confusing busywork.
There must be a larger plan.

Target you with Lightning Bolt
Resolves
Redirect to Planeswalker
I could see that being a potential "feel bad" that they want to fix

It would make more sense(I think) if they made it more of a targeting thing instead of a redirect issue. So instead of that situation mason you have to make it clear you're going after the walker the whole time. Which would make more sense to new players and create less gotcha moments
Agreed, the redirect rule is somewhat easy to utilize against newer players.
I think as they have more cards that specifically target walkers for damage and destruction they'll eventually phase put the redirection rule
or they could just abolish planeswalkers
That's never going to happen
obviously
Wouldn't it technically make walkers easier to kill since it would bypass Leyline of Sanctity type effects?
Those effects are played in only a few decks so they would be situationally easier against those specific decks.
It's like giving those spells the Propaganda problem.
I'm not saying that's a reason to do it mind you, just noting it
You're obviously the mastermind behind this plot, <@U4V5EHQ2G>.
I don't think the decks that run Leyline in modern run walkers either

Arriving late to the redirection rule change conversation, but this is actually the number one thing I've been hoping for wizards to change. Lightning Bolt can hit the same targets as Nahiri's Wrath, but if you compare them side to side, it sure doesn't look that way. I just hate when cards have invisible text.
Well, because one came out long before planeswalkers so some of that is inevitable in a game like magic.
Obviously. Propaganda and Sphere of Safety are the same way, but they function differently. Lightning Bolt shouldn't have the same functionality as Nahiri's Wrath unless it says so.
Errata won't change that. You need to go online to see the new version so there will always be invisible text.
Depends on the errata. Reprints will help. Fixing weird rules is a process. It can't happen all at once, the game is too big. I'm happy they're at least looking at it.
Holy poop, C17 Wizards Precon vs. Cat precon and I beat cats 2-0 O.o
Galecaster Colossus is a neat card for tribal Wizards. And I REALLY like Dimir Taigam
Flying, Menace
Nice 2/2 there
Flying Menace
I assume a Dino.
Nope, it's the first Boros Specter.
Specter tribal in RW?!
Dino specter?

i know but i expected you to gloss over it, thanks for going all out
Yeah I wanted it to be comprehensive both ways so that people can really get a good example of both methods.
The more you know right?
yeah this is great
good job
